content.p: This document describes steps necessary to use Sooda in your project. You'll need Visual Studio.NET 2003 and a SQL Server 2000 installation with the sample Northwind database. The tutorial is available in examples/Soodawind directory.

To download Sooda, go to the SourceForge download section. Pick up the latest version, download and run the executable (*.exe). On the options page, make sure that VC# .NET 2003 Wizards and Add bin directory to PATH options are checked or you won't be able to proceed with this tutorial.
Sooda comes with three application wizards that are available from VS.NET New Project option:
We'll be creating a simple console application. Let's name the project SoodaTutorial and click OK:
The wizard creates the following application files:

ul.li: SoodaSchema.xml - which defines the mapping between database tables and objects
App.config - which sets up the database connection type and connection string
ReadMe.txt - which contains description of the project

content.p: It also sets up the project build events so that the SoodaStubGen utility is invoked before each build. Because SoodaStubGen has been added to the PATH variable it can be executed without specifying a full path. If you've decided not to select "Add to PATH" option during install you may want to adjust your project Pre-Build Event to point it to the location of your SoodaStubGen.exe.
We now need to create a mapping schema that describes the corespondence between database tables and .NET classes. Let's start with a simple mapping for the "Categories" table to the Category class.
